word:
"The thought I have in mind is this,-- that there is a certain sense in which the sting is taken out of death here and now, brethren. [Hearty amens.] Our natural affections, the love of our hearts, will force the tears from our eyes, and we cannot help it; but back of it all, brethren, there is the consolation that sin has gone from this one, and hence the sting 
                                                                           455
of sin has been extracted, and death cannot hold such a person a great while. [Many amens.]
